p: The economic model is an age-structured decision tree model developed in Excel ( Fig 1). The age-stratified symptomatic influenza cases (output of the dynamic model described above) were used as inputs to the economic model. Based on available economic data, the age groups were re-categorized (0–1 years, 2–4 years, 5–14 years, 15–19 years, 20–49 years, 50–64 years 65–69 years, 70–74 years and 75+ years), using age-distribution data of the Spanish population [ 35]. Influenza cases were stratified between non-high-risk (NHR) and high-risk (HR) patients, based on the presence of underlying medical conditions [ 36], and were subsequently divided into four categories based on medical outcomes (no medical attention, outpatient visit, hospital admission, and death), with different complication probabilities for each category [ 37].
